title: Whereas we are informed that the price of corn, and all sorts of grain, meale and malt, is grown excessive high in several parts of this kingdom, which both arise as is conceived from the great quantities of corn which have been of late carried out of this kingdom, into foreign parts ... by the Lord Lieutenant and Council, Ormonde.
author: Ireland. Lord Lieutenant (1677-1685 : Ormonde)
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed by Benjamin Tooke and John Crook ... and are to be sold by Mary Crook ...,
